Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2009 11:36PM ijl wrote: I had 3 mm indetermined enhancement that was too small to biopsy. Had another MRI 6 months later and it was no longer there, they though it was hormonal changes. It's better to do MRI after your period if you still have them. I also had an MRI that showed something like a tumor that turmed out to be my gall bladder. MRI really does have very high percentage of false positives.

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2007 11:26AM ijl wrote: Hi twoweeks, It looks like from your posts that you are being treated at Stanford. I just wanted to let you know that I had 3 MRIs there and all 3 times I had false positives . In fact their MRI is set at some extra sensitive level, they make you sign a release for that. So don't worry too much if something shows up. BTW, my doctor is Dr Dirbas and I like him so much. He is very thorough and conservative. When I was looking for a breast surgeon , I had all my friends who had "doctor" firends ask them for suggestions. And Dr Dirbas name came up 90% of the time.
Posts.Title: waiting for mri results Twoweeks Twoweeks

Posts.Content: Dec 20, 2007 01:53AM ijl wrote: Hi twoweeks, You can still see Dr Dirbas after the New Year. There is no law that obligates you to the same doctor.  But if MRI is negative I think you can at least "relax" for 6 months. You already had a mammo, ultrasound and biopsy, all being negative.  So you really should be OK.
